page.title: 03 Farewell: The Hall.
page.content: Farewell Hall is a large red brick building standing near to the church. Its origins are very old, being built for the hermitage which was at Farewell before the nuns. Later it was turned into a farm house during Queen Anne's reign. It fell into a bad state of repair and then it was taken over.Now it is a training centre for a national company. Inside the hall, upstairs there are 14 bedrooms.They have long wooden beams that came from barges. Each room has 2 beds and some have wash basins. The cellar was once used as a slaughter room but is now a wine store.There is a secret passage leading from the cellar.It is thought that it once led to Farewell church.
